comingSoonMessage.title: Coming Soon
comingSoonMessage.description: Adaptive security settings will be made available in an upcoming update of the UES console.

operatingMode.title: Operating Mode
operatingMode.description: Specify an operating mode. Passive mode is used to collect data and build risk models for individual users without taking any action. In Active mode, the response actions defined in policies are applied. Alerts are generated in both operating modes. When the first user is added to an adaptive response policy, a training period for the adaptive response risk model is started and lasts until the following conditions are met: 1000 events are collected for the user's tenant and 14 calendar days pass. Alerts are not generated during the training period.

networkAnomaly.title: Network anomaly
networkAnomaly.description: Specify the threshold for network anomaly events and whether they are treated as high or critical risk. Network anomaly events are detected when a Gateway user's network usage pattern is not consistent with past behavior.

ipaddresses.specifiedAddresses: IP addresses, IP ranges or CIDRs

table.noDataInTrainingMode: Adaptive response uses a training period until the following conditions are met: 1000 events are collected for a user's tenant and 14 calendar days pass. Alerts are not generated during the training period.

passiveMode.title: Passive operating mode turned on
passiveMode.description: Automatic response actions will not be taken in passive operating mode.

common.automaticRiskReductionDescription: If you want to allow users to lower their risk level by reauthenticating to verify their identity, turn on automatic risk reduction. You must configure multifactor authentication in the authentication policy that is assigned to users or groups before you can use automatic risk reduction.
common.riskChanged: The risk level has changed from {{prevLevel}} to {{currentLevel}}.

arr.title: Challenge identity for automatic risk reduction
arr.description: Applies only to Identity risk detections

info.title: Risk Assessment
info.paragraph: Assign detections to risk levels to configure a risk posture for users. The risk level is used by policies to determine responses for events.

Add a policy to assign detections to risk levels to configure a risk posture for users. The risk level is used by policies to determine responses for events. If a user doesn't have a policy assigned, the default policy is used.
